column2: Sentence
column5: Comp Q

column2: The wise consumer understood the label was a very misleading one.
column5: Was the consumer easily tricked?

column2: The experienced boss emphasized the objective should not be abandoned yet.
column5: Should the goal be pursued further?

column2: The popular novelist wrote the essay would change the voters' minds.
column5: Would the essay influence anyone?

column2: The amateur musician learned the song couldn't be recorded for hours
column5: Could the song be recorded later?

column2: The coast guard confirmed the drowning could not have been avoided.
column5: Could the sailor have been saved?

column2: The upset customer asserted the complaint should be taken very seriously.
column5: Was the customer happy with the service?

column2: The devoted caretaker maintained the garden was causing his chronic allergies.
column5: Were cats the cause of his allergies?

column2: The stuttering child repeated the threat was highly unnecessary and hurtful.
column5: Was the threat mean-spirited?

column2: The two hunters heard that the birds had begun migrating in October.
column5: Were the birds migrating?

column2: The local publisher printed that the quote had not been accurately reported.
column5: Could someone have been misquoted?

column2: The distracted businessman forgot that the address was written in the e-mail.
column5: Was the address written on paper?

column2: The new mayor advocated that the strategy could be implemented next year.
column5: Does the mayor want to implement the strategy?

column2: The French explorers discovered that the treasure had caused a vicious battle.
column5: Had the treasure caused a conflict?

column2: The political group protested that the treaty had been broken many times.
column5: Had the treaty been followed?

column2: The basketball star accepted that the contract would have to be negotiated.
column5: Should the star sign right away?

column2: The angry residents warned that the kids had disturbed every single weekend.
column5: Were the residents pleased with the kids?

column2: The travel agent suggested the vacation would just have to wait.
column5: Was now a good time for a vacation?

column2: The new babysitter worried the parents would be several hours late.
column5: Did the babysitter worry the parents?

column2: The local detectives proved the conspiracy had been carefully covered up.
column5: Had the conspiracy been concealed?

column2: The cab driver assumed the blame belonged to the other driver.
column5: Did the cab driver claim responsibility?

column2: The district attorney argued the point would be impossible to avoid.
column5: Would the point be easily forgotten?

column2: The famous justice decided the case should never have been tried.
column5: Was the case tried?

column2: The injured woman suspected the teenager had hit her from behind.
column5: Did the woman suspect the teenager?

column2: The weary traveler claimed the luggage had been stolen in Rome.
column5: Did the traveler's luggage disappear?

column2: The naive child believed that the fable had been written for him.
column5: Was the child somewhat gullible?

column2: The shrewd salesman figured that the prices would be going up soon.
column5: Were the prices going to rise?

column2: The observant sleuth realized that the situation should be watched very closely.
column5: Was the detective careful and aware?

column2: The account executive concluded that the speech had not gone very well
column5: Did the speech please the executive?

column2: The football fan inferred that the score was due to several injuries.
column5: Were the players unscathed?

column2: The friendly clerk indicated that the price would be halved next week.
column5: Was the price steady?

column2: The new receptionist admitted that the mistake should have been corrected sooner.
column5: Should the receptionist have waited?

column2: The famous researcher implied that the findings had been revealed too soon.
column5: Were the findings revealed too early?

column2: The hero who destroyed the villain spent daylight hours in his lair.
column5: Did the hero spend the day in the city?

column2: The committee who met the applicant explained the reasoning for their decision.
column5: Did the committee neglect to give a reason?

column2: The expert who revered the source wrote a commentary on natural selection.
column5: Did the expert write a poem?

column2: The co-worker who intimidated the professional delayed his response to the question.
column5: Did the co-worker answer right away?

column2: The critic who acknowledged the writer discussed the strengths of the piece.
column5: Did the critic discuss the weakness?

column2: The bully who challenged the nerd began the quarrel with an insult.
column5: Did the bully start with a complement?

column2: The scientist who aided the technician assumed the blame for the error.
column5: Did the scientist blame someone else?

column2: The host who engaged the visitor described the route to the attractions.
column5: Did the host describe the attractions?

column2: The plumber who frustrated the janitor lost the key on the street.
column5: Did the plumber lose the key?

column2: The hairdresser who hired the beautician transformed the salon for the better.
column5: Did the hairdresser improve the salon?

column2: The lecturer who provoked the dean left the university in the summer.
column5: Did the lecturer leave during the summer?

column2: The trumpeter who loved the drummer formed the band two years ago.
column5: Did the trumpeter start the band?

column2: The intern who feared the boss disregarded the messages on her voicemail.
column5: Did the intern ignore her voicemail?

column2: The roommate who annoyed the landlord slammed the door of the apartment.
column5: Did the roommate close the door loudly?

column2: The player who avoided the coach entered the room at the gym.
column5: Did the player come into the room?

column2: The mayor who called the advisor requested an update on the project.
column5: Did the mayor ask for new project details?

column2: The librarian who the teacher angered misplaced the book from the depository.
column5: Did the librarian keep track of the book?

column2: The pharmacist who the assistant helped placed the order for the drug.
column5: Did the pharmacist order a coupon book?

column2: The waitress who the bartender hugged dropped the tray on the floor.
column5: Did the waitress drop the tray on the table?

column2: The client who the retailer contacted offered a deal of the century.
column5: Did the client retract a deal?

column2: The celebrity who the athlete admired won the award at the ceremony.
column5: Did the celebrity suffer a defeat?

column2: The detective who the spy recognized crossed the street at the light.
column5: Did the detective cross at the sign?

column2: The journalist who the editor complimented revised the article for the newspaper.
column5: Did the journalist work for a magazine?

column2: The employee who the executive praised finished the project right on time.
column5: Did the employee finish late?

column2: The legislator who the senator visited falsified the documents for the trip.
column5: Did the legislator use fake documents?

column2: The soldier who the enemy shot received a medal for the battle.
column5: Did the soldier receive an honor?

column2: The officer who the murderer described told a lie about the past.
column5: Did the officer say something that wasn't true?

column2: The reporter who the cameraman followed damaged the equipment during the trip.
column5: Did the reporter break equipment?

column2: The understudy who the agent telephoned shared the news about the suicide.
column5: Did the understudy talk about the death?

column2: The consultant who the programmer confronted broke the computer in a rage.
column5: Did the consultant get angry?

column2: The supervisor who the owner deceived kept the money in the end.
column5: Did the supervisor hold onto the money?

column2: The entrepreneur who the stockbroker hated sold shares after the merger.
column5: Did the entrepreneur get rid of his shares?

column2: The clerk at the records office clarified the confusing statement on the application.
column5: Was the statement very straightforward?

column2: The handsome prince offered but his bride's family declined the fortune.
column5: Would the prince remain a bachelor?

column2: The two friends wagered their allowance on who would get the highest test score.
column5: Did the friends bet on a baseball game?

column2: The mysterious woman divulged her deepest and darkest secrets to the bus driver.
column5: Was the woman very shy?

column2: The radio newscaster verified the short and exciting report before the broadcast.
column5: Was the report true?

column2: The bargain shopper saw the beautiful and expensive raincoat after the sale was over.
column5: Was the shopper careless with cash?

column2: The exuberant team planned a huge and extravagant party for after the game.
column5: Did the team feel good about things?

column2: The science teacher verified the unexpected results because she found them implausible.
column5: Did the results seem strange?

column2: The temporary assistant saw the short and inappropriate memo while rummaging through the files.
column5: Did the assistant notice the memo?

column2: The injured man imagined the attack while in the emergency room.
column5: Had the man been assaulted?

column2: The worried mother determined the explanation for why her son had been avoiding her.
column5: Was the mother concerned about her son?

column2: The flight attendant clarified the instructions when the passengers asked questions.
column5: Was the flight attendant helpful?

column2: The church workers offered the kids a free bible and some coloring books.
column5: Did the workers offer them food?

column2: The curious girl comprehended the answer but asked the question again.
column5: Did the girl understand the first time?

column2: The office staff raced but there was no clear winner.
column5: Did someone come in first place?

column2: The teacher's assistant divulged the purpose of her colleague's absence.
column5: Did the assistant know the purpose?

column2: Many of the cheerleaders recalled the difficult and strenuous routine from last year's homecoming game.
column5: Did the cheerleaders forget the routine?

column2: The attorneys for the family disputed the authorities' version of what transpired.
column5: Were the events completely agreed upon?

column2: The wealthy investor regretted the bad and unfortunate decision once he realized the consequences.
column5: Was the investor rich?

column2: The models in the fashion show revealed their stylish tank tops.
column5: Were the models wearing sweaters?

column2: The I.R.S. agent demanded the full amount the week following the audit.
column5: Did the audit go well?

column2: The poodle recognized his owner's scent on the clothing that was discovered.
column5: Did the dog have a keen sense of smell?

column2: The waitress promised her regulars a free cup of coffee.
column5: Would the regulars have eggs?

column2: The foreign students sat down but couldn't understand the lecture.
column5: Were the students a bit confused?

column2: The angry mob announced their demands but still refused to negotiate.
column5: Did the mob want to compromise?

column2: The nervous teenager lied to the judge to avoid incriminating his friend.
column5: Did the witness commit perjury?

column2: The bored librarian painted her fingernails after shelving several books.
column5: Was the librarian very busy?

column2: The interior decorator hammered away and hung the painting on the wall.
column5: Did the decorator hang a poster?

column2: The new salesman insulted the stranger and she left the store.
column5: Was the stranger satisfied?

column2: The soccer player kicked the ball through the goalie's hands.
column5: Did the soccer player score?

column2: The thoughtful daughter cared for her elderly mother.
column5: Was the mother taken care of?

column2: The new homeowner slept in the room next to the garden.
column5: Did the homeowner sleep near plants and shrubs?
